intro: Muniria lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf muniria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Muniria lanceolata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
